news.title: KCCA FC Secure Late Win to Close Title Race
news.summary: KCCA FC produced a dramatic late winner against Express FC to keep pressure on the Premier League leaders.
news.content: KCCA FC came from behind to beat Express FC 2-1 at Mandela National Stadium on September 30, 2025. After a first-half opener from Express, KCCA equalised early in the second half and snatched victory in the 87th minute with a composed finish from their striker. The result keeps KCCA within touching distance of the league leaders and was praised by fans and pundits for the team's resilience.
news.author: Samuel Akello

news.title: Vipers SC Announce New Head Coach Ahead of Continental Campaign
news.summary: Vipers SC have appointed former international midfielder Alex M. as head coach as they prepare for CAF competition.
news.content: Vipers SC confirmed the appointment of Alex M. as their new head coach on August 12, 2025. The club said Alex brings a modern tactical approach and a strong focus on youth integration. The appointment comes ahead of Vipers' return to continental competition and completes a summer rebuild that included three signings and an improved academy pathway.
news.author: Press Office - Vipers SC

news.title: Uganda Cranes Name 25-Man Squad For AFCON Qualifiers
news.summary: The Uganda Cranes coach named a strong 25-man squad combining experienced internationals and emerging talents for the upcoming qualifiers.
news.content: On July 4, 2025, the Uganda Cranes unveiled a 25-player squad for the Africa Cup of Nations qualifying fixtures. The list includes established stars playing abroad as well as local standouts from the Uganda Premier League. The technical team emphasised balance across midfield and attack while highlighting the importance of defensive solidity for the tough away fixtures ahead.
news.author: Nina Kaggwa

news.title: Stadium Upgrade Completed in Jinja; Fans Praise Facilities
news.summary: Renovations to the Jinja Municipal Stadium are complete, delivering upgraded seating, lighting and player facilities.
news.content: Local authorities and the Ministry of Sports officially reopened the refurbished Jinja Municipal Stadium on May 18, 2025. The work included new seating sections, improved floodlights, an upgraded pitch drainage system and refurbished changing rooms. Matchday volunteers and supporters praised the improved accessibility and safety measures introduced as part of the upgrade.
news.author: Pauline Otieno

news.title: Young Talent: Allan Okello Scores Brace in Youth Development Showcase
news.summary: Allan Okello starred in a youth showcase match, scoring twice and setting up another to highlight the strength of local talent.
news.content: In a development showcase on March 29, 2025, Allan Okello delivered a standout performance, scoring two goals and creating another as the select XI beat a visiting youth side 4-1. Coaches at the event praised the quality of finishing and creative play, noting that increased investment in academies is translating to better outputs on the field.
news.author: Daniel Tumusiime

news.title: Express FC Launch Community Outreach Programme
news.summary: Express FC kicked off a community initiative focused on youth coaching, health clinics and school visits across Kampala.
news.content: Express FC launched a broad community outreach programme on November 10, 2024 aimed at using football as a tool for social development. The project includes free coaching sessions for schools, seasonal health checks and mentorship schemes. Club officials said the move reflects Express FC's commitment to grassroots growth and social responsibility.
news.author: Community Relations Team

news.title: KCCA FC Advance in CAF Competition After Penalty Shootout
news.summary: KCCA FC progressed to the next stage of CAF competition after a dramatic penalty shootout victory in June.
news.content: KCCA FC secured passage to the next round of the CAF tournament on June 21, 2024, prevailing in a tense penalty shootout after a 1-1 aggregate tie. Fans celebrated a gritty defensive display and calm spot-kick conversions, while the coach lauded his players' mental strength under pressure.
news.author: Sports Desk

news.title: FUFA Announces Calendar Changes to Improve Player Welfare
news.summary: FUFA published a revised calendar intended to reduce fixture congestion and improve rest periods for players across competitions.
news.content: On December 2, 2023, the Federation of Uganda Football Associations (FUFA) released changes to the domestic calendar designed to create longer breaks between intense match periods and align some fixtures with international windows. The changes aim to reduce injuries, support recovery and enhance club planning. Clubs welcomed the consultation-led process that preceded the announcement.
news.author: FUFA Communications

events.title: Stadium Development Initiatives
events.description: Major investments were made in stadium infrastructure across Uganda, improving facilities for both clubs and the national team.

events.title: URA FC Wins Uganda Cup
events.description: URA FC lifted the Uganda Cup trophy, defeating Express FC in a competitive final match.

events.title: Vipers SC Founded
events.description: Vipers SC was officially founded, beginning a journey that would see them become one of Uganda's most successful clubs.

events.title: Express FC Century Celebration
events.description: Express FC celebrated their rich history and contribution to Ugandan football with special commemorative events.

events.title: Youth Development Program Launch
events.description: FUFA launched a comprehensive youth development program aimed at nurturing young Ugandan football talent from grassroots level.

events.title: Women's Football League Established
events.description: The inaugural season of the Women's Football League took place, marking a significant step for women's football in Uganda.

events.title: Millennium Football Revival
events.description: The new millennium brought renewed interest and investment in Ugandan football, with improved league structures and competitions.

events.title: Introduction of Professionalism
events.description: The Uganda Premier League transitioned to a fully professional league, enhancing the quality and competitiveness of domestic football.

events.title: First International Victory
events.description: The Uganda Cranes secured their first major international victory in a regional tournament, boosting national pride.

events.title: Uganda Cranes AFCON Triumph
events.description: The Uganda Cranes won the Africa Cup of Nations, defeating Ghana 2-0 in the final to claim Uganda's first and only AFCON title.

events.title: SC Villa Founded
events.description: SC Villa was established, beginning their journey to become one of Uganda's most successful and beloved football clubs.

events.title: First Uganda Cup Held
events.description: The inaugural Uganda Cup competition was held, providing a new platform for clubs across the country to compete.

events.title: SC Villa Dominance
events.description: SC Villa began a period of dominance in Ugandan football, winning multiple league titles and cups throughout the decade.

events.description: The Uganda Premier League was restructured into a more professional format, improving standards and organization.
